page.title: 15Wellington Barracks,Bury
page.content: On Bolton Road is a building known locally as 'The Barracks'.In fact it is the Lancashire H.Q. of the Regiment of Fusiliers.The original{Wellington {Barracks}were built on an adjacent site in 1845.They were occupied by the regimental H.Q. and a depot of the 20th or{East Devonshire Regiment of {Foot}on its move to Lancashire in 1873.In 1881 the regiment became the {Lancashire Fusilers.}Regular recruits were trained at Wellington Barracks, which came to be regarded as the 'home' of the regiment until 1961 then the depot was moved again.The original barracks were demolished in 1969.The building is now also used as a regimental museum.
